results.title: Is ACE inhibition with lisinopril helpful in diabetic neuropathy?
results.text_hl: Is @GENE_AP2B1 @GENE_163 @@@ACE@@@ inhibition with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ helpful in @<m>DISEASE_Diabetic_Neuropathies</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003929 @@@diabetic neuropathy@@@?

citations.NLM: Reja A, Tesfaye S, Harris ND, Ward JD. Is ACE inhibition with lisinopril helpful in diabetic neuropathy? Diabet Med. 1995 Apr;12(4):307-9. PMID: 7600744

results.title: Effects of lisinopril on streptozotocin-induced diabetic neuropathy in rats.

citations.NLM: Aggarwal M, Singh J, Sood S, Arora B. Effects of lisinopril on streptozotocin-induced diabetic neuropathy in rats. Methods Find Exp Clin Pharmacol. 2001 Apr;23(3):131-4. PMID: 11523311

results.title: Rapid reversal of a motor nerve conduction deficit in streptozotocin-diabetic rats by the angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitor lisinopril.
results.text_hl: Thus, the marked functional effects seen for vasodilator treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ suggest that angiotension converting enzyme inhibitors may have potential therapeutic value in the treatment of @<m>DISEASE_Diabetic_Neuropathies</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003929 @@@diabetic neuropathy@@@.

citations.NLM: Cameron NE, Cotter MA, Robertson S. Rapid reversal of a motor nerve conduction deficit in streptozotocin-diabetic rats by the angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitor lisinopril. Acta Diabetol. 1993;30(1):46-8. PMID: 8392403
citations.BibTeX: @article{8392403, title={Rapid reversal of a motor nerve conduction deficit in streptozotocin-diabetic rats by the angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitor lisinopril.}, author={Cameron NE and Cotter MA and Robertson S}, journal={Acta Diabetol}, volume={30}, number={1}, pages={46-8}}

results.title: The implications of angiotensin-converting enzymes and their modulators in neurodegenerative disorders: current and future perspectives.
results.text_hl: @GENE_AP2B1 @GENE_163 @@@ACE@@@ inhibitors such as @CHEMICAL_Ramipril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017257 @@@ramipril@@@, @CHEMICAL_Captopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002216 @@@captopril@@@, @CHEMICAL_Perindopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D020913 @@@perindopril@@@, @CHEMICAL_Quinapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077583 @@@quinapril@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@, @CHEMICAL_Enalapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004656 @@@enalapril@@@, and @CHEMICAL_trandolapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:C052035 @@@trandolapril@@@ have been documented to ameliorate the above @DISEASE_Neurodegenerative_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D019636 @@@neurodegenerative disorders@@@.

citations.NLM: Kaur P, Muthuraman A, Kaur M. The implications of angiotensin-converting enzymes and their modulators in neurodegenerative disorders: current and future perspectives. ACS Chem Neurosci. 2015 Apr 15;6(4):508-21. PMID: 25680080
citations.BibTeX: @article{25680080, title={The implications of angiotensin-converting enzymes and their modulators in neurodegenerative disorders: current and future perspectives.}, author={Kaur P and Muthuraman A and Kaur M}, journal={ACS Chem Neurosci}, volume={6}, number={4}, pages={508-21}}
